direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods check for the existence of an attribute key, with the difference being case sensitivity.
Both methods check if an attribute has a declared value, with the difference being case sensitivity.
Both methods handle case-insensitive attribute key lookups, but one checks for a declared value while the other retrieves the value.
Both methods manipulate attributes with case-insensitive keys, but one checks for a declared value while the other sets or updates the value.
Both methods modify the state of attributes with case-insensitive keys, but one checks for a declared value while the other removes the attribute.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing attributes is a prerequisite for checking if an attribute has a declared value.
Setting an attribute value is a prerequisite for checking if it has a declared value.
Retrieving an attribute value can be used to verify the presence of a declared value after checking with hasDeclaredValueForKeyIgnoreCase.
